title: ELISA Assay 1/5: Plate Coating
author: Opentrons
description:
Links:
 Part 1: Plate Coating
 Part 2: Addition of Blocking Buffer
 Part 3: Addition of Samples
 Part 4: Addition of Detection Antibody
* Part 4: Addition of Avidin-HRP, TMB Substrate, Stop Solution
Day 1: With this protocol, your robot would be able to perform plate-coating with a coating antibody on a 96-well plate.

You will need:
 P300 Multi-channel Pipette
 96-well Plate
* 12-row Trough
process:
Set the transfer volume to each well.
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol onto the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your tiprack, pipette, plate, and petri dishes using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support articles:
Calibrating the Deck
Calibrating the Pipettes
Hit "Run Job".

markdown.title: ELISA Assay 1/5: Plate Coating
markdown.author: [Opentrons](http://www.opentrons.com/)
markdown.description:
Links:
* [Part 1: Plate Coating](./1475-ledtechno-part1)
* [Part 2: Addition of Blocking Buffer](./1475-ledtechno-part2)
* [Part 3: Addition of Samples](./1475-ledtechno-part3)
* [Part 4: Addition of Detection Antibody](./1475-ledtechno-part4)
* [Part 4: Addition of Avidin-HRP, TMB Substrate, Stop Solution](./1475-ledtechno-part5)

Day 1: With this protocol, your robot would be able to perform plate-coating with a coating antibody on a 96-well plate.

---

You will need:
* P300 Multi-channel Pipette
* 96-well Plate
* 12-row Trough
markdown.process:
1. Set the transfer volume to each well.
2. Download your protocol.
3. Upload your protocol onto the [OT App](https://opentrons.com/ot-app).
4. Set up your deck according to the deck map.
5. Calibrate your tiprack, pipette, plate, and petri dishes using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support articles:
 * [Calibrating the Deck](https://support.opentrons.com/ot-one/getting-started-software-setup/calibrating-the-deck)
 * [Calibrating the Pipettes](https://support.opentrons.com/ot-one/getting-started-software-setup/calibrating-the-pipettes)
6. Hit "Run Job".
